website_summaries.verdict: Everything from its large font, loud yet clear volume, and extremely simple design make this flip phone the optimal model for senior citizens.
pros: External display shows who is calling
cons: It’s easy to call 911 by mistake via the SOS button on its rear

customer_reviews.title: be careful of the SOS button!
customer_reviews.text: This phone's SOS button is on the side of the phone which is a terrible place. The first day of use my husband accidently called 911 twice while using the phone, and one time he had it in his shirt pocket while working and he bent over and it made the call. They took his name and told him if it happened again he could get charged for falsely calling them. Idiotic set up! I would have given it no stars, but I had to rate it somehow for the review. My advice is to get a different phone.
customer_reviews.author: debbie r.

customer_reviews.title: Easy as it says.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this telephone for my mom. She is 92 years old. It is very easy to operate, has big buttons and charger base is very helpful instead of plugging in wire. I would highly recommend this telephone for seniors.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: User friendly
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my 93 year old mother. It’s user friendly and very legible. Would recommend it for seniors.
customer_reviews.author: Tana Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Description Lies
customer_reviews.text: The phone was a Christmas Present and we go to hook the phone up and Tracfone (which in the description says it is compatible with) tells me the phone is not supported by them, that this phone does NOT work with their service. Needless to say I am very disappointed and this was a waste of my time and money!
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: Good Phone Easy to View and Fast Shipment
customer_reviews.text: Good phone for Senior, Easy View, SOS Button for Senoir, Huge TEXT.. Very Fast Shipment...........will buy this shop again
customer_reviews.author: Alex Wong

customer_reviews.title: The price do not match with the phone, really expensive to a basic cell
customer_reviews.text: well I consider that is an expensive phone reviewing their features which are very limited. But if you are looking a basic phone for seniors is the best until now that amazon have until now listed. Sound is ok but it is not enough alone for hearing desabilities In senior. If this is your case you need to conect the phone to another device by Bluetooth which I found really complicated. No wifi. I hope this help others.
customer_reviews.author: diana

customer_reviews.title: no customer service help
customer_reviews.text: got this phone a few months ago as it had large letters and easy to navigate. The comes with an instruction book that the print is so small you can not read it even with a magnifying glass plus not written for easy reading for seniors. Impossible to contact easy phone. Problem is I love how it handles and large letters, I found it impossible to set voice mail and phone book numbers.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Thorne

customer_reviews.title: Lovely Phone would not connect to TMobile Network
customer_reviews.text: I was totally excited for this phone, it is and beautiful phone for my elderly momma and she was thrilled to receive on Christmas morning however; when I took to TMobile becasue it takes a smaller sim card than her current phone and I needed to swap it out; the phone would not connect to the Tmobile network leaving the phone useless except for making emergency calls. Huge disappointment to my mom and the rest of us. I guess I will have to look local for a phone that will accomdate her needs and be TMobile compatabile.
customer_reviews.author: suzann hembree

customer_reviews.title: The SIM compartment would not hold the SIM card
customer_reviews.text: The phone seems to be great for elder parents and such, however the issue is with the SIM card compartment. My unit came with a SIM "door" which was 1-2 MM too large for the SIM card, resulting in the card being loose inside the compartment (the contact between card & SIM housing wasn't tight enough) and in signal being lost, dropped or the dreaded "No SIM inside the phone" message. After taking the phone to T-Mo, we confirmed the issue with another card and therefore the phone can not be used as such. I discovered the issue too late for a return and now my 4 year old plays with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too complicated to be called a "senior" phone
customer_reviews.text: Easyfone advertises this phone as a "senior" phone, but it's really quite complicated. It has features like an FM Radio, flashlight, SOS buttons, camera, Internet search, etc. While some of these "features" can be partially deactivated by clever programming, they can also mysteriously turn themselves on and off again. For example, pressing the scroll down button turns on an FM radio. There is no way to prevent this. To turn off, you have to press the "Exit" soft key or "hang up" button. Try explaining that to your elderly mother. Why do engineers always feel that more is better? I wish someone made a dirt simple flipphone with none of these added "features."
customer_reviews.author: TomK

customer_reviews.title: What an awful phone
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the worst phone I have ever had. The battery goes dead after about 2 hours of usage. Instructions were meant for a picture literat in Chinese. Much too complicated and unreliable for the elderly & down right impossible to use for a person not computer savvy. Wouldn't buy another if it was the only version on sale; going back to name brand phones.
customer_reviews.author: Julian Weglarz

customer_reviews.title: Screen turns white
customer_reviews.text: We like the size of numbers both on screen and on phone but battery doesnt last very long and we have charged several times and the screen every once in a while turns white for no reason. We have to turn the phone off ad restart the phone for it to clear up. Quite annoying if u want to use. We also like the ability to turn the volume way up. It is also a good looking phone. WE DONT KNOW HOW TO GET AN EXTRA BATTERY. I HAVE TRIED ONLINE AND ON AMAZON.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Easier to talk with my Grandpa now
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my grandpa who couldn't use the smartphone we got him. He says that it's a lot easier for him to use than the other stupid phone as he calls it. Been way easier to get in touch and talk with him so I definitely appreciate that. Perfect for anyone who doesn't like all the extra features that a smartphone has.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Not User Friendly For Senior Citizens
customer_reviews.text: If multiple youngsters at a cellular carrier store has difficulty trying to maneuver and text, it will be a feature that a senior citizen will simply not use; which is very disappointing to the user and gift-giver. The seller/manufacture should put their heads together to make a change for the better. By the way, guess what the user does when they accidentally turn on the radio and want to turn it off? They power cycle the phone.
customer_reviews.author: ICD

customer_reviews.title: Good flip phone for parents
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my dad as he is against smart phones at all costs. He prefers this flip phone which will not break easily. So its working good for him. Obviously not much you can do with the phone, but overall has good battery life and its very easy to use. Although I think there are many cheaper options available so value for the money not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Phone!!
customer_reviews.text: The phone was exactly what I was looking for. My mother had a stroke and is in a rehabilitation center, relearning the basics, walking talking and yes using a phone. This phone is perfect has everything she needs, AT&T was helpful in putting her SIM card from her iPhone in and it works perfectly. Did not have to change or cancel her existing plan. Will be buying another one for my dad who is hard of hearing and iPhone challenged. Easy to set up, add contacts and set speed dial numbers. Speaker volume is perfect! Clear and great signal strength. Great phone!!
customer_reviews.author: Angsted

customer_reviews.title: Good phone
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought this phone because of the claim that it would connect to the existing phone carrier. To my surprise and delight, it did. I have bought others and returned them because they had other carrier's software like AT&t. I use Puretalk, and it is compatible to the towers.. I read a bad review on ths device about how small the print is in the manual. It is no different than any other manual. I also read a bad review that talked about connecting to 91 with out pressing the button . It is easily disabled.. I'm still learning about this phone, but overall, it is good.
customer_reviews.author: sirbaldman

customer_reviews.title: For my mother
customer_reviews.text: Got this phone for my mother because she doesn’t know how to use her smart phone. The number is are big and displays are large. Does everything that she needs just to call and pick up phone calls. Simple enough for her .
customer_reviews.author: Fang

customer_reviews.title: Best Phone for Seniors
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for an older relative. She loves this phone. Couldn't work the other supposedly elder-friendly models from the telecoms, and was always calling (me) for assistance. Now she can call Great Calls customer assistance with any questions and receive fast, friendly, knowledgeable help. I've called on her behalf a couple times and was truly amazed at the high-quality customer service. The call quality is excellent, the costs are reasonable, and the billing is straightforward. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend this to anyone needing a simple easy-to-use flip phone.
customer_reviews.author: Lina

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Verizon network!
customer_reviews.text: I found this out after I ordered the phone, went crazy trying to activate it, and took it to not one but two Verizon stores. At the first store, the salesperson was unfamiliar with the phone and sold me a SIM card for it, but apparently didn't realize that wasn't the problem. At the second store, they looked it up online and said it doesn't work with their network, pure and simple. I can't even figure out where to return it, and for the price it's hardly worth sending it overseas! Feels like a gyp. It certainly should be stated in the ads and description that it might not work with some phone networks!
customer_reviews.author: Epona

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and long lasting battery
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my grandfather as a gift and he is happy with it. This is more convenient for him rather than having touch screens. The battery last long too. It's very light and the size is perfect! So handy and works well for him. Happy with the purchase! Would recommend it for grandparents.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Young

customer_reviews.title: Basic flip phone for budget-minded folk.
customer_reviews.text: My husband wanted a flip phone. He puts the phone in his pants pocket. Butt dialing used to be a problem. He moved phone to front trouser pockets...They just don't belong anywhere near reproductive organs or the brain for long periods of time (bluetooth orientated accessories, etc.) He's having trouble retrieving voice mail messages. Basically as a "talk" only phone it is good. The speaker phone is great. Nice crystal clear sound and audible. He plays telephone tag quite a bit. If he doesn't answer the call fast enough...into the bottomless, non-retreavable message center they go. We use CC as our carrier and had zero problems porting his office number.
customer_reviews.author: Mary H

customer_reviews.title: This phone doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: First this phone says that it works with Tracfone. The SIM cards don't fit. Second. I had to get an ATT Sim card which means that i had to pay a monthly fee for the phone. The directions that came with the phone were unintelligible. Even after calling Tech Support (that i paid extra for) the tech agreed that the instructions come from China and didn't make sense. I sent it back. Only good thing was that i got a refund after days of trying to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Mary A. Naber

customer_reviews.title: My 90 year old mother can use it.
customer_reviews.text: For my 90 year old mother. She uses it ONLY to make and receive calls. I programmed the 10 phone numbers for the persons she talks to the most. I didn’t set it to record messages, it is to complicated for her. The stand to charge the battery is great, otherwise she would have a hard time connecting it. I wish it did not have so many other things like a radio. But she just ignores everything else.
customer_reviews.author: I Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Not as simple as it should be.
customer_reviews.text: The pros are the buttons are plenty big and it’s easy to use since it’s a flip phone. This is my mom’s first cell phone so simplicity was an absolute must. Which brings me to the cons. Why am fm radio? Why a web browser? Why is it so hard to just find s phone that can at the most text? I get all the extra features if this was a regular cell phone but not for one that boasts of being simple and easy. Even the camera is a waste. I mean it takes terrible pictures anyway why not just do away with it.
customer_reviews.author: dru1313

customer_reviews.title: Easy for my mother to use.
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to use for an older person with memory problems, since she only has to open the phone to answer it and not have to know which button to press. I turned off the SOS button since my mother would press it frequently and not talk when I answered the phone. She uses speed dial to call me, and I set several numbers to speed dial my phone to make it easier. My only complaint is that if the # key is accidentally pressed, it mutes the sound including the ringer.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Westfield

customer_reviews.title: My grand ma loves it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone for my grandma who doesn't use smart phone and needs a hearing aid, she has been struggling with her old phone for being too small and button are tiny too. Moreover, she have complained to me multiple times about not being able to hear the right tone and being overly complicated. Easyfone provided a great solution for all her problem, as being said all her tech problem was solved by this phone, now she picks up the phone with in few right and can call her loved ones anytime and find out if we are eating properly or not.
customer_reviews.author: Anu

customer_reviews.title: Okay product
customer_reviews.text: Glad it has the medical information input-good for emergencies. Bought this for the charger stand and no more plugging in with hoping the phone last longer. Some settings are different from other flip phone, but, it answers phone calls, so I'm fine with that. -Amazon, when are you going to have your own cellular service, as well as, residence home and internet service?
customer_reviews.author: kathlee

customer_reviews.title: Should come with a SIM card that fits the compartment within the phone!
customer_reviews.text: The phone seems to be great for elder parents and such, however the issue is with the SIM card compartment. My unit came with a SIM "door" which was 1-2 MM too large for the SIM card, resulting in the card being loose inside the compartment (the contact between card & SIM housing wasn't tight enough) and in signal being lost, dropped or the dreaded "No SIM inside the phone" message. I purchased, bring your own phone , that had 3 sizes of SIM cards and none would fit properly. NO QUICK instructions came with the phone either. Great phone if they provided a SIM Card that works....had to return
customer_reviews.author: TN Belle

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.text: Now I know why the Company sends two batteries.....after 1 day of use the battery is dead. You have to keep the other battery charged so that you can exchange it the next day. That means opening up the back cover and putting in the charged battery. Very disappointed! Please, don’t waste your money! I found out the hard way.
customer_reviews.author: schion

customer_reviews.title: Flip Phone
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't wait to get this Phone.I am Very Disappointed.It won't hold charge.I have tried both batteries,neither would hold Charge.I will be Returning it ! I will say it seems to be well built but Problems with the Phone ! I tried setting it up,My Daughter & her Husband are very Technical.They couldn't set it up either ! EASYFONE,NOT !!!
customer_reviews.author: Terry Lee

customer_reviews.title: Better than jitterbug
customer_reviews.text: Purchased jitterbug first for grandparent , this phone sets up much easier. Two best features are every time they shut the phone it resets to home screen in case they are confused and the m1 m2 buttons make calling your top 2contacts the easiest it can possibly be. Only complaint is it is very small in the hand to hold and manage
customer_reviews.author: Matt L.

customer_reviews.title: Super cheap but Sim fills up fast,  voicemail requires password
customer_reviews.text: I like the price, durability and loud speaker. I'm 33 and I don't use my phone as a computer or camera since I already have a lap top. I didn't want to text but I've been forced to because I lost my voicemail password and now there's no way to access my own voicemail which should be illegal. It is possible to text with this but read the directions. It took me a few weeks to figure out how to switch the text settings around and I'm very tech savvy. It also seems durable. It keeps a charge for about 24hrs. Easy to charge usb and charges up really quick.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Horrible phone!
customer_reviews.text: I actually would rate this phone a big fat 0. I bought it for my senior mother. It would never hold a charge from day one. The screen would randomly freeze to a whiteout, we would have to restart phone to get rid of the blank screen. Very poor quality. My mother was constantly frustrated with this phone.
customer_reviews.author: Darla Piceno

customer_reviews.title: easy to use flip phone
customer_reviews.text: I bought this flip phone for my 87 year old mother n law. She has poor eye sight and has trouble with technology. This phone was near perfect for her. The large font display and larger key pad makes daily use of a phone less of a chore for her. The old phone was a subject of multiple complaints by her. The phone hooked up to our AT&T account perfectly and I transferred her contact numbers with little hassle. I made points with this gift with my wife and my mother n law.
customer_reviews.author: William Hall

customer_reviews.title: Poor battery life
customer_reviews.text: The phone works like it is design to, although it is hard to navigate. The main issue is the battery life. The battery is absolutely terrible. I’m having to charge constantly and I’ve only been using it for a week.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Good phone for hearing impaired.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this phone for my 89 year old father-in-law. It synced with his hearing aids automatically so he can hear what is being said and it is easy enough to use that even with only one working hand, he is able to make a call. The only problem we have experienced is that he can't put it in the charging dock hard enough for it to begin charging as he no longer has that much hand strength. However, overall it is a wonderful choice for someone with limited hand coordination and hearing difficulties.
customer_reviews.author: Debra L. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for elderly
customer_reviews.text: I'm liking this phone more than i thought, i have an Smartphone but i want to get this one for my trips in Asia when I'm travelling. Very light weight. Easy to use. Battery life is great. But great point of this deal is you can get extra battery came with the box. Love this phone so much. Keyboard is big enough if you can not see good. Anyway. If you're looking for a unlock flip phone so this is a good choice for you
customer_reviews.author: Kaylee

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Super Lite phone , it is very easy to use I got this for my grandfather The cradle charger resembles a cordless phone stand and makes for easy charging while doubling as a phone stand. The keys are large and backlit. Battery life in feature phones have never really been as much as a worry as with smartphones and a single charge has lasted me days
customer_reviews.author: Mohamed Abu elgheet

customer_reviews.title: A good basic phone
customer_reviews.text: Im very happy with this phone Just what I needed for a basic Cell Phone. Excellent product, reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: No issues on T-Mobil
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the MIL who has a hard time with any kind of technology. This is about as basic a phone as you can get. She still struggles a little with it, but she is elderly and doesn't understand the gizmo. Setting up contacts was a bit of a chore, but once you figure it out it is straightforward. We took this and her old phone to T-Mobil and they switched the SIM card and made sure we were good to go before leaving.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use for seniors mentally challenged
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone for my husband who has dementia and needs a phone with easy access (flip phone) to answer. It also has 2 speed dial separate touch pads for emergency or frequently dialed numbers. I work 2 days a week and check on him frequently, and if he has to call me with an emergency there is also a SOS button on back. Easy to charge using cradle provided, large fonts and a big screen. It does take a micro sim card (provided free from my carrier-consumer cellular). Battery life is good. So far, no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Darzy

customer_reviews.title: Great for little kids
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this, my elementary-age son. He was keep asking for a phone. Since he is not very mature to control himself for smartphones, I purchased this. It is now very convenient to control where he is. the phone itself is very functional it reminds me of old Nokia days. I found it very good quality, design and so forth. The color is also another factor for beauty :)
customer_reviews.author: Ike Fydone

customer_reviews.title: A Little Aggravating But Overall Good Phone
customer_reviews.text: The cell phone is louder and has bigger buttons than other cell phones. However, the volume buttons on the outside of the cell phone can be easily pressed in your pocket and cause the cell phone to go unheard when a call comes in because the volume was inadvertently turned down while in your pocket. The flashlight button works the same way. The text message functions are also a little more complicated than other phones, but overall it is as good as other phones.
customer_reviews.author: Wes Carter

customer_reviews.title: senior friendly
customer_reviews.text: My 93 yr old father bought this phone a week ago & found it better than his previous cell phones he had.The one thing he liked the most was the charger stand that eliminates trying to put a cord in.The second thing he liked most was the m1& m2 quick dial to my sister & I.He also can keep his consumer cellular plan by using the old sim card & placing it in the metal compartment of the phone,back of battery.
customer_reviews.author: scottjbrenner

customer_reviews.title: Good user friendly phone for my father
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this phone for for my father. He don't use smart phone. He specially want the flip model because his previous phone was not a flip model and he was butt dialing every now and then. He said the battery last longer than his older phone and the sound quality is good too and the main thing he is not miss dialing anybody any more.
customer_reviews.author: manish

customer_reviews.title: Flip phone loaded with assistive features for Seniors.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great option if you are looking for a solid flip phone that is easy to use, and voice comes through vey clear. There are many extras for Seniors to help them keep track of phone (strap while carrying, dock while charging). It is a good option for someone looking for this type of phone.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer1

customer_reviews.title: Think twice if purchasing for elderly
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this phone for my elderly parents as they only occasionally need to make phone calls. I attempted to set-up and activate the phone and discovered it would not be an easy process for them. I accidentally turned on the FM radio (which is not a feature they needed) and struggled to figure out how to turn it off or even turn down the volume. At this point, I determined the phone would not meet my elderly parents’ needs. I gave 3 stars because the phone may work well for younger or more experienced cell phone users.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this phone is junk and has been since we bought it.
customer_reviews.text: disliked everything about it. It sounded good in its description, thought it would be the perfect phone for my aging boyfriend, but disappointment was was soon to follow charging it. the battery had no life in it, must of been the original. it does not keep a charge. we would miss several phone calls as the setting woud get reset and would discover it was turned all the way down. it just done the strangest things. the screen went completely white yesterday. so our nightmare of a phone is finally over. i do not recommend the phone at all to anyone. just wish i had of returned following receiving it.
customer_reviews.author: april starr

customer_reviews.title: Works great w ATT
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my wife's step-father. She delivered it to him today, and he loves it... especially the lanyard and charging base as he does have some tremors. He just called to thank me. ATT store set up no problem, just took a while for it to find the network - and then no problems at all. Phone held charge for 36 hours (w/o use) and still had battery showing full, so we anticipate no problems there. ATT rep was impressed and said he was going to get one for his grandmother. (Lanyard is a total pain to thread. Finally resorted to fishing line to pull it through.)
customer_reviews.author: Joe T

customer_reviews.title: poor quality- received TWO defected products
customer_reviews.text: I received a defected product - the front screen did not work and the metal clasp that normally holds the SIMS card was damaged. I reordered the product and received YET ANOTHER FAULTY PHONE. This time the box was missing the charging cord, screen lit up but it did not display any writing or the time, as advertised. I ordered this phone for my elderly grandma with the hopes that it would be simple to use and convenient. Hard to tell since it did not work. Would not order again. DO NOT recommend.
customer_reviews.author: klaudia

customer_reviews.title: A big button two function phone: place a call, answer a call.
customer_reviews.text: The price for this phone is considered a great buy. The basic operation of this phone is easy. What I mean by easy is you flip it open and dial, and at the end of the call just close the phone to hang up. Anything else, you need Einstein’s brain. I gave the phone to my 95 year old mother and I tried setting up a contacts list of her frequently dialed numbers. I was not able to figure it out and I do consider myself savvy when doing this stuff. There is much work to be done before this phone gets the classification of “easy to operate “
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Poor Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this phone for my mother. When it comes to phone technology, my mother is still in the flip phone era. Her major complaint is battery life. She only uses it to make calls and they are far in between. She has to charge phone battery everyday. For a flip phone that makes a call or two per week, that is very poor battery life. She have requested several time for me to get her a new phone, because of the poor battery life of the phone.
customer_reviews.author: myracle

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for those having problems with smartphones
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my dad that was having a difficult time with his new smartphone. He pretty much quit using it because he had trouble figuring it out, now I call and he usually answers right away and he has no problems with being able to see the numbers.
customer_reviews.author: reeac

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it for the price. Not senior friendly.
customer_reviews.text: I got this phone for my 80 year old father. He currently has a smartphone and finds it confusing to navigate so I decided to get him this flip phone, which is geared towards seniors. I am disappointing. First, the phone feels cheap, and not worth $65. Second, to program contacts to the phone it is VERY confusing. Not worth it. I'm already looking to get a different phone.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Roman

customer_reviews.title: Good for some, but not for us.
customer_reviews.text: This phone functioned, and for some the large numbers are enough good to outweigh the bad, but it was constantly giving my father (whom this was purchased for) major headaches and was replaced within 30 days because neither of us could get it to behave as a normal phone.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: compact and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: excellent simple and easy phone to use. I had one of those smart phones, but they are too complicated & bulky to put in your pocket. This one is great ! I like the fact that you can fold it and put it in your pocket without worrying about accidentally hitting one of the buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar B.

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for seniors
customer_reviews.text: We tried several phones, and this is the best for my husband to use. It is easy for him to operate (he only has use of one hand) and the best part is he can hear the caller. "SOS" button too easy to press accidentally, but easy to disable in the settings.
customer_reviews.author: TERRIE HART

customer_reviews.title: Poor battery life
customer_reviews.text: My husband hardly uses his phone, maybe 2-3 per day. I think the longest conversation he's had was 5 minutes. But every two days he needs to charge the phone. And that's with turning it off at night.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Louise

customer_reviews.title: It is very easy to operate, has big buttons and charger base...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this telephone for my Dad. He is 71 years old. This is a simple phone with easy to touch and see buttons. I would highly recommend this telephone for seniors citizens. It is very easy to operate, has big buttons and charger base is very helpful instead of plugging in wire.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Richards

customer_reviews.title: Not Happy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone for my mom but when I first turned it on it had music playing and couldn't turned it off So obviously someone else had it before I bought it and I wanted a phone easy for my mom but it was horrible So I'm returning it and getting a Jitterbug
customer_reviews.author: cindy husfelt

customer_reviews.title: A good basic phone
customer_reviews.text: My son is too addicted to his cellphone so I looked for a phone that can only be used for communicating. I bought one last time for him but that one didn’t work. I returned it and bought this phone instead.I use Cricket Wireless and not all the phones can work with it. This one is the one I’m looking for and it works just great .
customer_reviews.author: viviJ

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have used this phone as a backup phone for a while, everything is fine, there are not many functions, and the functions are very simple. I don’t need too many functions as a backup phone. The size of the phone is just right for me, it is lightweight, the keyboard is big, and the numbers on the screen are also very big. When I don’t need a backup phone, I can give it to my grandma. The screen and buttons are easy for her to use.
customer_reviews.author: Iris’s

customer_reviews.title: Charging "station" is great!
customer_reviews.text: For those who have loved ones who need a simple phone, this is the one. There are no extra buttons to confuse. There is a charging "station" that is easy to use because there is no need to fit a charging cord into a tiny hole. The sound quality compared to the last flip phone he used is superior.
customer_reviews.author: Sweetie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this phone for my husband who has Parkinson's Disease. He is not able to use a smart phone because of tremors so the push buttons are great. Also it is simple to use since neither of us is very tech oriented.
customer_reviews.author: Joan M.

customer_reviews.title: This phone isn't what it's claimed to be
customer_reviews.text: It said that it was compatible with at&t but the sim card doesn't work. Terrible product I would never recommend it. James Hopkins
customer_reviews.author: JCH

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't charge, Easyfone won't refund
customer_reviews.text: The charging base failed to work twice (with original order and replacement order), so my wife and I purchased another phone for her 89-year old mother. She needed a phone and couldn't use the USB cord to charge the phone (her 89 year-old fingers can't manage) so the charging base HAS to work. Easyfone has been polite, but when I requested a refund as we had to go out and find a new phone, their response was "...enjoy the new phone."
customer_reviews.author: Dale Stokdyk

customer_reviews.title: Nice Phone
customer_reviews.text: Only recently purchased for my elderly mother, so full review not possible as yet. However, the great features of larger numbers, bigger screen, flip to answer and end call are great for her
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Martin

customer_reviews.title: Simple phone with great features and at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone for my grandmother and she couldn't be happier. It's very easy to use and all of the buttons and menus can be seen easily. She is also happy with the features and the simplicity of the phone helps her navigate any and all of the options. The battery life, durability and the sounds quality is great.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G.Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Battery life  lasted 3months completely dead
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is absolutely horrible It hasn't been a year since I purchased this for my mom to use Battery life is dead won't even power on
customer_reviews.author: Yuri Hing

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use, Very User Friendly
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to use. Bought this for my elderly uncle and he loves it. Buttons are big, screen is bright and the speakers are loud. You can also customize the emergency button or turn it off!
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Castilo

customer_reviews.title: A Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: This phone was for my father who loves the flip phone. It is a very nice design, I love the outer display information, the charging dock, the flash light and it has been easy for him to use. A Great Buy!
customer_reviews.author: martha londono

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Buy This Phone!
customer_reviews.text: The phone is nice looking BUT no SIM card and no video of the same phone that was sent to me. They have videos of the phone on how to put the SIM card in BUT there is no SIM card and there is no video that shows the same picture of the back of the phone where a SIM card should go. When you call to get some support for this problem you can’t talk to anyone you can understand!!! 😡
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Mom can use it
customer_reviews.text: Finally a cell phone that my 80yr old mother is not intimidated by.
customer_reviews.author: B. Maynard

customer_reviews.title: Accidental 911 calls!  The emergency button on the outside gets pressed easily in pockets.
customer_reviews.text: My Dad kept triggering the emergency button with the phone in his pocket. This is a terrible terrible design. Also, it included two batteries, and neither one lasted more than 14 hours on a full charge without even using the phone. Absolute garbage. I wound up getting my 92 year old dad a ZTE Blade smart phone afterward and it and he finds it easier to use anyway!
customer_reviews.author: Trip Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Yay! Finally a phone that my elderly mother is comfortable with...
customer_reviews.text: And she gets to keep her old phone number because it has a sim card. She has a hard time reading the screen on a smart phone. For this one, she just opens the phone to answer it and closes it to hang up. She can see the contact list to make phone calls. I had a hard time inserting the sim card at first. Then I read the directions. The battery life seems fine. Plus there is a spare battery that she can always keep charged.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best phone for our elders/grown big parents
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone for my old uncle.he just loved it .it is easy for him to read the digits ,dial the phone ,speaker is good The best thing is he can put it around his neck.there is no fear of forgetting it somewhere and losing it The phone quality is good .reached in time and good packing.
customer_reviews.author: kamna beri

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: Charging was horrible Battery life was 3hrs max but it came with 2 i guess
customer_reviews.author: Naram joo

customer_reviews.title: The speaker feature is great, and the large numbers on the screen are also great.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this phone for a short time now, I really like it. The only part I haven't gotten used to yet is entering the name and phone number of friends and family. I am 87 years old and it takes me a little longer to figure these things out, but I will make it.
customer_reviews.author: FGG, Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Did not withheld the time test.
customer_reviews.text: It broke after 6 months. Wouldn't hold charge at first and kept turning off on it's own schedule until one day just wouldn't turn on anymore. And this was used by my elderly dad just for phone calls.:(
customer_reviews.author: TauTau

customer_reviews.title: How to put the phone together.
customer_reviews.text: The instructions about the sim card and the memory card were not accurate enough. I could not tell how the cards were suppose to be placed. There was no large photo of the phone showing the location of the cards. When instructions are written they should be used by someone who does not know anything about putting the cards in the proper location. the designers write the instructions where they understand them with out consideration of people who are not familiar with the phone.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Parks

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our mom, but she couldn’t get reception in her area. She has a hard time seeing well, and the names weren’t large enough for her to see. We returned it, and got her a jitterbug. She loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Nantucket

customer_reviews.title: Elder phone
customer_reviews.text: Got this flip phone for my uncle to replace his other flip phone. This is fine except it has an FM radio in it. Why? I have no idea but I do know he hits the radio button by mistake and gets confused as to why his phone is talking to him
customer_reviews.author: M. K.

customer_reviews.title: Product review.
customer_reviews.text: The product is perfect. However, the ATT store in Washington Square, Beaverton , OR refused to sell or install a sim card in the phone and made my wife buy one of their phones. Going on line to the ATT web site they say the have a special on and the sim card is currently free. We have been life time customers of ATT but will be changing soon. Joseph Dunn
customer_reviews.author: JOSEPH D.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. I bought this because of what was described as simple, good quality for an elderly person. I finally after six months took him to get it connected. As soon as we left the store a radio went on and no one could figure out how to get it off. WTH. Anyone buying a flip phone needs simplicity.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple & affordable phone for seniors
customer_reviews.text: Simple flip phone - light weight and not bulky, clear big font, louder volume sounds. Everything is great for seniors. reasonable price is plus!
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with tracfone like it says it does!
customer_reviews.text: What a scam/rip off. Doesn't work with tracfone or straight talk. Tried to email easyfone_support@yeah.net like it said.. no reply. =| Don't waste your time or money on this phone.
customer_reviews.author: Dodecahedron

customer_reviews.title: Not too complicated to use.
customer_reviews.text: Have only had the phone for a few days so I don’t know about durability and battery life. It’s my husband’s and he was able to figure it out fairly quickly, so the ease of use is good. The delivery was prompt and the phone was as represented.
customer_reviews.author: Gj72

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: It does the job to the navigation is not so intuitive. Back in 2004 there were better phones than this one; with better sound, better material quality and a much more intuitive interface.
customer_reviews.author: Diego Santistevan

customer_reviews.title: Returned because phone would not charge.
customer_reviews.text: Phone would not take charge and also had a rep. from AT&T check charging situation as was told to return item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: phone
customer_reviews.text: This is a very suitable mobile phone for the elderly, I bought it for my mother, because she does not use too many features, and this phone is suitable for her use. The font displayed on the mobile phone is very large, the reading is very clear, the words of the button are also very large, the basic functions are all available, and the card can be used, which is convenient. Very good, my mother likes it very much.
customer_reviews.author: mich

customer_reviews.title: Nothing so far
customer_reviews.text: My charger dock station has a short and will not charge my phone. Very hard to get intouch to replace it. No contact number just an E-Mail. Not happy
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Poag

customer_reviews.title: Not easy!  Not intuitive
customer_reviews.text: This phone was so hard to understand that we couldn’t even give it to the person we bought it for. Could not figure out navigation to contacts or how to add them
customer_reviews.author: Janet Malecki

customer_reviews.title: For a senior this phone needs to be a bit larger
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for one of my senior friends and complains about how often she has to charge it. Overall it's a good phone and serves its purpose
customer_reviews.author: Beverly

customer_reviews.title: CHEAPEST AND WORST PHONE EVER
customer_reviews.text: The Easyfone Prime A1 3G Unlocked Senior flip phone never took a charge and therefore never worked, despite it being brand new. The company would not allow us to return to phone despite it being defective. Do not buy this phone ..... lemon laws don't seem to apply with this company
customer_reviews.author: Wesley P.

customer_reviews.title: A COMPLETE BUST
customer_reviews.text: Internal parts are fragile. The first time I tried to insert the SIM, the SIM holder came loose from its moorings and I was not able to reattach it. Also---although this phone is advertised as good for seniors, it is far too small for arthritic hands to manipulate. I was never able to operate it. A waste of money and time. I have already ordered another phone from another source. I recommend to Amazon that they remove this piece of junk from their inventory.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret B. Russell

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this phone for my husband this April ( 4 months ago) . The batteries will not hold a charge. The phone came w/ 2 batteries and neither one holds a charge for more than 18 hours. My Husband rarely uses the phone and most days it sits on his desk unused. The phone is dead is in less than 18 hours w/ no use. If he uses the phone the charge lasts maybe 12 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Maria T Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Very good customer service.  Fast service will go the extra mile to solve any issue u may have
customer_reviews.text: Had a minor issue with phone and was exchanged promptly. overall performance of phone is good. Elderly mother can read numbers fine.
customer_reviews.author: I. Sulak

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money or time on this phone!!
customer_reviews.text: This phone is not easy to use and gets horrible service. Don’t waste your time or money. And now I’ve had the phone for 2 days and Amazon is giving me problems to return it. OMG
customer_reviews.author: help

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy defective
customer_reviews.text: The phone burnt up In My grand mothers hand she said. She is out of town and going to send it back to me so i can return it.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Davis-Humes

product_meta.title: Easyfone A1 3G Unlocked Senior Flip Cell Phone, Big Button Hearing Aids Compatible Easy-to-Use Flip Mobile Phone with Charging Dock(Black)
feature_bullets: Classic flip design, Flip to answer calls; Big button for easy dialing, Big Volume for easy hearing and with simple operating system easy to use.
2.4'' HD Main Display+1.44'' External colorful screen, Big Font & Big Icon for easy viewing; 2.0MP camera, MMS/Tasks/FM/Flashlight/etc useful features.
Special SOS button with ICE Manual; M1 and M2 Dedicated Direct dial keys and # Key 2-9 eight numbers can be set as Speed dial button.
Cutting Edge M4/T4 Hearing Aid Compatibility(HAC), ideal for the customers with hearing aid devices.

【Select Prepaid SIM Card】Compatibility Nationwide on 2G/3G carriers like AT&T or any other carrier that use AT&T network(Select Prepaid SIM Card). Will NOT work with T-Mobile/MetroPCS, NO CDMA Carriers (Verizon, Sprint, Boost, PagePlus)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.3 out of 5 stars1,384 ratings3.3 out of 5 stars
specifications.Additional Features: AT&T, Lycamobile, Cricket, Straight Talk, H2O wireless, and MetroPCS Compatible, HAC Compatible, External Display
